posts.post_content: When I think of "Limitless Power", I don't think of spending 7 to get some slow, conditional discard. This should blow of a limb or wipe the board or something.

When I think of "Limitless Power", I don't think of spending 7 to get some slow, conditional discard. This should blow of a limb or wipe the board or something.

Posted By: Polychromatic (5/4/2011 5:16:35 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: People need to learn that discard that costs more than 4 mana altogether is, in the best case scenario, simply win-more, and is usually much too slow. The best discard (arguably, I know about [hymn to Tourach](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=hymn to Tourach)) is [Mind Twist](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Mind Twist). I've had three of them for a long time, and I don't think I've ever used it for more than 3. The only kind of deck that will still have that mana cards and aren't mana screwed are control decks, and they will just counter it, meaning a [Duress](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Duress) would do the same thing. This is the reason why I never understood the hype around [Mind Sludge](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Mind Sludge)- by that point, a hymn would work just as well. I know discard, it's always been my favorite black strategy.
posts.html:

Posted By: MarlinFlake (6/2/2011 7:31:45 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: way too expensive for what it does. the other opponent will most likely have no cards in hand by the time this goes off. 7 mana investment is not worth it when you can get the same effect for [mind sludge](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=mind sludge). unless some non black deck desperately needs the opponent to have no hand, this card is almost unplayable. the other shrines are [shrine of boundless growth](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=shrine of boundless growth) [shrine of limitless power](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=shrine of limitless power) [shrine of loyal legions](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=shrine of loyal legions) and [shrine of piercing vision](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=shrine of piercing vision).

posts.post_content:
"How many cards do you have?  
Six?  
Muahaha.  
You see, with this button, I can- wait. Hold on a second. Its booting up, you see.  
Stay there, and **don't move**.  
One... two... three...  
Hey, that hurt! Hold still.  
Four...  
I said stop it! Its my turn, dammit. Be a gentleman.  
Five... ok. that's enough. *DISCARD YOUR HAND FEEBLE MAN*!  
Hey, you said you had *six* cards! You *lied*! What the *hell*, man?  
You played your cards? But I told you to wait! This game blows, man."

posts.post_content:
This reminds me of [Discordant Dirge](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Discordant Dirge).  
  
Both are too expensive and by the time they actually do something, your opponent probably has no cards in hand.  
Also, i really dont like that this has an activation cost of *4*. So it can easily die to removal unless you are willing to keep 4 mana open at all times... Which definitely isn't worth it.  
  
  
1.5/5

posts.post_content: 3/5. Pretty much everything that's been said about this card is true, but I would at least sideboard it against a certain type of deck. My friend runs [Arcanis the Omnipotent](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Arcanis the Omnipotent) in EDH, and he usually has massive card advantage late in the game, giving him full permission ability. If this was fully charged, it could swing the balance back in my favor, and he can't counter the activated ability of an artifact.

Posted By: landboysteve (9/20/2011 6:54:53 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
This has the most baffling name.  
Let's run through the other shrines, shall we?  
White: Shrine of Loyal Legions: Okay, Legions = Armies = Lots of tokens. Good  
Blue: Shrine of Piercing Insight: Piercing Insight=Looking through the top of your library for the best option. Good.  
Red: Shrine of Burning Rage: As you hold in your anger it grows so strong it can completely incinerate the other person. Good.  
Greed: Shrine of Boundless Growth: As it grows larger it gives you more mana. Good.  
  
Shrine of Limitless Power: It... Uh... Denies your opponent from having their stuff? I got nothing.
posts.html:

Greed: Shrine of Boundless Growth: As it grows larger it gives you more mana. Good.

Shrine of Limitless Power: It... Uh... Denies your opponent from having their stuff? I got nothing.
